All users use Microsoft Skype for Business Online for collaboration.
You plan to deploy Microsoft Teams phones to all users.
A company policy has the following requirements for the Microsoft Teams phones:
✑ The screen saver must be enabled and configured to start after 60 seconds.
✑ Screen capture must be enabled.
You need to configure the Microsoft Teams phones to meet the policy requirements.
Which of the following actions should you perform?

discussion.content:
Correct.

TAC -> Devices -> IP Phones -> Configuration Profiles -> Device Settings
Seems that they moved this to TAC--> Teams Devices --> phones --> configuration profiles --> Add --> device settings.

The correct option is D. Configure a Teams policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center. A Teams policy allows administrators to control various settings for Teams users in the organization, including screen saver and screen capture settings. In the Microsoft Teams admin center, you can create and manage Teams policies, assign them to specific users or user groups, and ensure that they are applied consistently across the organization to meet the company policy requirements.

D. Configure a Teams policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center.

In order to configure the Teams phones to meet the policy requirements, you should create a Teams policy in the Microsoft Teams admin center. Within the policy, you can configure settings such as screen saver and screen capture.
You can use the "Device settings" option in the Microsoft Teams admin center under "Teams policies" to configure the settings for the Teams phones.
You can then assign this policy to the desired users or groups of users.

Note: A & B are not related to configure Teams phone settings and C is to configure settings for mobile devices but not for Teams phones specifically.

You work as a Systems Administrator for your company. The company has a subscription to Microsoft 365. All users in your company have a Microsoft 365 E3 license.
All users use Microsoft Teams for collaboration.
Users in the company frequently invite external users to Microsoft Teams meetings.
Users report that when the guests join the meetings, they have to wait in the lobby until they are admitted by the meeting organizer.
You need to configure the system to ensure meeting participants join the meeting directly without waiting in the lobby.
What should you do?

choices.C: A litigation hold on the user's mailbox.
choices.A: The user's Microsoft 365 license options in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center.
choices.B: A meeting policy in Microsoft Teams.
choices.D: A Sensitivity Label in the Security & Compliance Admin Center.

discussion.content:
Answer C is correct. 
To preserver electronically store information (ESI), you can put selected users or all users on legal hold to make sure that all message interchange are discoverable by the organization's compliance manager or teams admins. 
This has to be done in the Microsoft 365 Compliance center, creating a case to set the legal hold.
Answer is correct...

Selected Answer: C
A ideia da retenção de litígio é não permitir a exclusão das informações, neste caso da pergunta, as conversas privadas.
Como o Teams é um front end ele não armazena nada, tudo ficar armazenado em algum serviço da nuvem da Microsoft, para entender melhor as dependências do Teams acesse ( https://learn.microsoft.com/pt-br/training/modules/explore-teams/5-architecture) 
Quando um usuário conversa em particular, essas mensagem são armazenada na Mailbox do usuário, e dentro do Centro Administrativo do 365 é possível habilitar o litigo:
Painel ADM365-> Usuário-> Clique em Usuários ativos-> Selecione o usuário que você deseja colocar em Retenção de litígio-> menu de propriedades-> selecione a guia Email-> Em Mais ações,-> Gerenciar retenção de litígio-> Ativar litígio e insira detalhes opcionais.

permanent deletion from the SubstrateHolds folder is always suspended if the mailbox is affected by another Teams retention policy for the same location, Litigation Hold, delay hold, or if an eDiscovery hold is applied to the mailbox for legal or investigative reasons.
